document.docAuthor: Lelej, Arkady S. & Loktionov, Valery M.
document.masterDocTitle: Review of the nominotypical subgenus of Arachnospila Kincaid (Hymenoptera: Pompilidae) of Russia and neighbouring countries with the lectotypification of enigmatic Pompilus sogdianus Morawitz and description of new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Review of the nominotypical subgenus of Arachnospila Kincaid (Hymenoptera: Pompilidae) of Russia and neighbouring countries with the lectotypification of enigmatic Pompilus sogdianus Morawitz and description of new species

Pompilus ( Arachnospila ) fumipennis eisukei
Ishikawa 1969
: 1
, Ƥ 3 [ holotype , 3 "Karuizawa, Nagano Pref.,
24 .VIII. 1954

subSubSection.paragraph:
(Ishikawa)" [Honshu, Japan ], deposited in the National Science Museum, Tokyo, examined].
Arachnospila ( Arachnospila ) eisukei :
Lelej 1995
: 238
(Ƥ), 241 ( 3 ); 2000 : 623 ; 2005 : 8 , Ƥ;
Loktionov et al . 2009

Arachnospila eisukei :
Loktionov & Lelej 2010
: 54
.

Diagnosis of male. Hypopygium basally without sharp differences between sclerotized and unsclerotized parts (Figs 10, 11 ); median carina of hypopygium preapically distinctly concave (lateral view) (Fig. 11 ); genitalia as in
Fig. 31
; flagellomere 8 length 2.4–2.6 × its width;
2 r-m
vein of fore wing slightly curved (Fig. 48 ); hind wing as in Fig. 49 ; metasoma black.

Diagnosis of female. Protarsomere 1 with three spines of tarsal comb; fore and hind wings as in Figs 46, 47 ; flagellomere 7 length 2.7–2.9 × its width; flagellomere 8 length 2.7–3.1 × its width; metasoma black.
